results.abstract: Ridley Scott and his all-star cast rip the moldy fig leaf off chivalric romance in a he-said, he-said, she-said spectacle.

results.title: Selma Blair Wants You to See Her Living With Multiple Sclerosis
results.abstract: The actress puts herself out there in “Introducing, Selma Blair,” an unflinching documentary that she hopes can help others.

results.title: Visconti’s Operatic Autopsy of German History, Restored Anew
results.abstract: The trilogy of “The Damned,” “Death in Venice” and “Ludwig” is whole again, in editions that freshly reveal their conflicted queerness.

multimedia.caption: Helmut Berger as King Ludwig II of Bavaria in Luchino Visconti’s “Ludwig,” the sprawling third installment of his so-called German trilogy.

results.title: Ruthie Tompson Dies at 111; Breathed Animated Life Into Disney Films
results.abstract: One of a cadre of women who worked behind the scenes, she did indispensable but anonymous work on classics like “Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs” and “Pinocchio.”
des_facet: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Ms. Tompson in an undated photo. “What she did,” an animation historian said, “ended up on the screen — whether you see her hand or not — because of the way she supported the directors’ vision.”
Ms. Tompson in an undated photo. “What she did,” an animation historian said, “ended up on the screen — whether you see her hand or not — because of the way she supported the directors’ vision.”

results.title: Chucky Returns to Terrorize TV. His Creator Couldn’t Be Happier.
results.abstract: The gay filmmaker Don Mancini introduced the killer doll in 1988, and as the “Child’s Play” franchise has evolved, so has its queer sensibility.

multimedia.caption: “The idea of causing some people’s heads to explode was catnip to me,” Mancini said about the choice to make the new series’s protagonist an openly gay teenager.

results.title: The Passion of Questlove
results.abstract: The drummer, D.J. and producer is everywhere and loved by everyone. But few understand what drives him: an obsession with spreading the joys of Black music.

results.title: Netflix employee who criticized Dave Chappelle’s comedy special is among three suspended.

results.title: James Bond Returns and Theaters See Reason for Hope
results.abstract: “No Time to Die” has taken in more than $300 million worldwide. The overall box office remains fragile, however, and the future for films that aren’t part of big-budget franchises is unsure.
